  +
'''''FIFA 11''''' ('''''FIFA Soccer 11''''' in [[North America]]) will be the 18th title in [[Electronic Arts]]' ''[[FIFA (series)|FIFA]]'' series of [[Association football|football]] [[video game]]s. Developed by [[EA Canada]], it will be published by Electronic Arts worldwide under the [[EA Sports]] label on 28 September 2010 in [[North America]], 30 September 2010 in [[Australia]], and 1 October 2010 in [[Europe]] for all platforms, except the [[Wii]]. The Wii version will be released on 3 October 2010 in North America and Europe.<ref name="releasedates">[http://www.computerandvideogames.com/article.php?id=254712 FIFA 11 release date confirmed], computerandvideogames.com</ref> The Windows version of ''FIFA 11'' will be the first in the series to use the same game engine as the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.
'''''FIFA 11''''' ('''''FIFA Soccer 11''''' in [[North America]]) will be the 18th title in [[Electronic Arts]]' ''[[FIFA (series)|FIFA]]'' series of [[Association football|football]] [[video game]]s. Developed by [[EA Canada]], it will be published by Electronic Arts worldwide under the [[EA Sports]] label on 28 September 2010 in [[North America]], 30 September 2010 in [[Australia]], and 1 October 2010 in [[Europe]] for all platforms, except the [[Wii]]. The Wii version will be released on 3 October 2010 in North America and Europe.<ref name="releasedates">[http://www.computerandvideogames.com/article.php?id=254712 FIFA 11 release date confirmed], computerandvideogames.com</ref> The Windows version of ''FIFA 11'' will be the first in the series to use the same game engine as the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.
â
==New features==
+
== New features ==
* '''Next Gen Gameplay Engine (PC, PS3, Xbox 360)''': The game engine that is used for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions of the game will now be used on the PC.<ref name="pcnextgen">[http://www.easportsfootball.co.uk/news/item/file/FIFA-11-PC-More-Details EA Football World], More PC Details Confirmed</ref>
* '''Next Gen Gameplay Engine (PC, PS3, Xbox 360)''': The game engine that is used for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions of the game will now be used on the PC.<ref name="pcnextgen">[http://www.easportsfootball.co.uk/news/item/file/FIFA-11-PC-More-Details EA Football World], More PC Details Confirmed</ref>
Line 40: Line 41:
* '''Improved Celebrations (PS3, Xbox 360)''': Celebrations will now use the in-game camera rather than separate cutscenes. It is also confirmed that teammates can now join in celebrations. Also, only more skilled or acrobatic players can perform the more acrobatic celebrations, such as a back flip. ''FIFA 11'' also includes players' signature celebrations, which they can perform with a simple push of a button. For example, if the player scores with [[Tim Cahill]], the player will box the corner flag. <ref name="BackPage">[http://www.ea.com/uk/news/the-backpage-fifa-11-update?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=news&utm_content=Twitter Fifa 11 Update], The Backpage</ref>
* '''Improved Celebrations (PS3, Xbox 360)''': Celebrations will now use the in-game camera rather than separate cutscenes. It is also confirmed that teammates can now join in celebrations. Also, only more skilled or acrobatic players can perform the more acrobatic celebrations, such as a back flip. ''FIFA 11'' also includes players' signature celebrations, which they can perform with a simple push of a button. For example, if the player scores with [[Tim Cahill]], the player will box the corner flag. <ref name="BackPage">[http://www.ea.com/uk/news/the-backpage-fifa-11-update?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=news&utm_content=Twitter Fifa 11 Update], The Backpage</ref>
â
==Demo==
+
== Covers ==
  +
Each regional version of ''FIFA 11'' features different players on the cover. [[KakÃ¡]] will be featured on the cover globally.<ref>http://kotaku.com/5605780/kaka-is-fifa-11s-worldwide-cover-athlete</ref> The [[United Kingdom]] and [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] covers feature KakÃ¡ and [[Wayne Rooney]]; the [[Australia]]n cover features KakÃ¡, Wayne Rooney, and [[Tim Cahill]];<ref>http://www.kotaku.com.au/2010/08/fifa-11-box-art-puts-tim-cahill-at-centre-forward/</ref> , the [[North America]]n version features KakÃ¡, [[Carlos Vela]], and [[Landon Donovan]].
  +   +
== Demo ==
A ''FIFA 11'' demo will be available to download on 15 September 2010 for PS3 and Xbox 360 and on 16 September 2010 for PC.
A ''FIFA 11'' demo will be available to download on 15 September 2010 for PS3 and Xbox 360 and on 16 September 2010 for PC.
